ai.summary: Cullompton Cloth Trail is a roughly 6 km moderate hike through UK countryside. The route stays at a steady pace with gentle elevation changes, suitable for walkers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: The path consists of a mix of compacted dirt tracks, gravel lanes, and grassy sections. Expect uneven surfaces, occasional muddy patches after rain, and gentle ascents and descents.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast before you go. Wear sturdy, grippy footwear and dress in layers with a waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths, watch for uneven ground and slippery grass, and be prepared for weather changes typical of the UK. Bring water and snacks, a map or GPS, and ensure your phone is charged. If walking with others, share plans and times and close any gates you pass through.
recommended_gear: Lightweight rain cover or pack liner
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; year-round walking is possible, though winter conditions can be muddy and weather can be harsher.
